channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2023080766
item.description:
Report E-2023080766

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN1993 PenRay Winter Pow-R Plus Diesel Anti-Gel release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 7-gallons of product released to a 15’ x 8’ area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area and then collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080562
item.description:
Report E-2023080562

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 1, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint UN3066 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) cups to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ambipar to remediate the impacted surfaces. Ambipar personnel deployed granular absorbents to the corrosive paint-related material-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the one (1) 5-gallon damaged pail was placed in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023080570
item.description:
Report X-2023080570

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Approx. around 6:15am Hazmat steel drum was found sitting on the belt line damaged. There was a small amount of spilled paint at the top of drum around cap. Steel drum was placed into a red hazardous tote and moved to hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: There was a small amount of paint spilled around the top of drum where cap is located. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Steel drum was placed into a red hazardous tote using proper eye and wear gear to transport to hazmat cage for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023080567
item.description:
Report X-2023080567

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by a manager at door 124 at KANN-289. Hazmat was brought to QA Hazmat cage for inspection. During the inspection it was found that the cap was broken/missing. The remaining cap was missing and not found inside the packaging. DescribePack: The failure was due to a broken/missing cap on one of the glass bottles. No other caps or bottles were damaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bottles and package were placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023080558
item.description:
Report X-2023080558

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080558 SequenceEvent: Package was processed and being delivered to Outbounds, Load Area 1. A few minutes later, manager explained to me box was leaking powder. Box was not leaking beforehand. Probable cause of leakage could be mishandling of package by package handler. No damages to outer packaging. Cleaned up area by sweeping up powder substance into the QA bin with the damaged hazmat in bin as well. DescribePack: Lid of Inner packaging was loose and seemed to be the source of leakage. Location of the loose end was the back of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Checked to see if all openings were closed and package was standing upright. 2. X-2023080636 SequenceEvent: Package was found in outbounds by management leaking the substance. DOT hazmat label was located on the package and QA was called. QA contained spill and placed package in hazmat tote. DescribePack: Package had loose lid causing contents to spill out DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Substance was contained and package was placed in hazmat tote

item.title: Report E-2023080323
item.description:
Report E-2023080323

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a NA1993 Spec-Aid 8Q123ULS release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-teaspoon of product released impacting a 5" x 1" area of the tote lid due to being crushed/punctured as a result of improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with cleanup debris into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When unloading at the facility it was noticed that the floor around the tote was wet. They immediately put down absorbent material to collect the material. Tote was removed from truck and our inhouse response team arrived to transfer the material to a new tote. It was discovered that a small pinhole was in the top of the tote and the material would seep out. There was less than 0.5 gallons released and was all contained in truck no material made it out of the vehicle. The cleanup process was completed while wearing the proper PPE and all material was packaged and processed in the proper manner.

item.title: Report E-2023080247
item.description:
Report E-2023080247

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LTU experienced a UN1789 Blue Whale Muriatic Acid release from 2 boxes, each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released impacting a 1' x 1' area of the concrete dock floor due to the product falling as a result of improper loading. The impacted area was neutralized with soda ash and then cleaned with granular absorbents. All cleanup debris and neutralized cardboard were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The (8) 1-gallon bottles of damaged leaking product were placed into an additional 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2023080193

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: DECATUR
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NDE experienced a UN1263 Cycon UV-HighGloss Monolyer 757-4F release from a 5-gallon steel pail due to improper loading. XPO terminal personnel donned PPE and contained and cleaned the release with granular absorbents. The damaged pail and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080172
item.description:
Report E-2023080172

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide Monohydrate release from (2) 50-pound poly bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released impacting a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged bags and released product were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080170
item.description:
Report E-2023080170

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: BRAINTREE
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XEE experienced a UN1993 Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 release from a 300-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released impacting a 5' x 5' area of the trailer floor due to a bad weld on the tote. Contractors transferred the product from the damaged tote into a new 275-gallon poly tote and 55-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All waste was collected into a separate 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080163
item.description:
Report E-2023080163

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLU experienced a customer location release of UN1090 Acetone from a box containing (4) 1-gallon metal cans. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and located one cardboard box of LAPALM Acetone that was slightly wet with residual Acetone. There were no wet spots or residual product on the trailer floor. The XPO driver had already separated the damaged box and delivered the rest of the load to the customer. Contractors placed the box into a 55-gallon metal drum which was then transported back to XPO terminal XLU located in Louisville, KY and staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080146
item.description:
Report E-2023080146

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: NORTH HUNTINGDON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XPB experienced a UN1993 Tyzor IAM release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released impacting a 5' x 5' area of the concrete dock floor and an 8' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. Oil dri and simple green were utilized to clean the impacted areas and then collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080130
item.description:
Report E-2023080130

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLA experienced a UN3108 Varox DBPH-50 release from (2) 45-pound boxes. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-pound of product released impacting a 3' x 3' area of the trailer floor due to being crushed as a result of improper loading. The released product and damaged boxes were containerized into (2) 55-gallon vented poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080075
item.description:
Report E-2023080075

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN2924 "M2488" release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and a tote transfer. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 12-ounces of product released impacting a 1' x 1' area of the dock floor due to a crack on the top corner of the tote. Crew began by neutralizing the released product with a soda ash solution and using spill pads to collect all free-standing liquid. The product was then transferred into a new tote for shipment on. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with the spill pads and PPE into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080070
item.description:

  • City: BUTTE
  • State: MT

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBU experienced a UN1823 Caustic Soda Beads release from (3) 50-pound poly bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-pound of product released impacting a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor due to a pallet puncture. The damaged bags, released product, and impacted pallet pieces were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining cargo was re-secured for shipment on.   • City: BESSEMER

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NBM experienced a UN3266 Zep Concentrated Driveway and Concrete Cleaner release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released impacting the trailer floor and cardboard box due to a fork blade puncture. The crew advised the release evaporated and there was no product to clean off of the floor of the trailer. The damaged jug and impacted cardboard were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining cargo was re-secured for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: During loading there was no signs of product leaking. Driver moved to the customer scale on site and noticed the turpentine smell and then saw a leak coming from the bottom forward section of the insulation through a weep hole. Driver moved it to the customer containment area on site. We formulated a game plan with the shipper to transfer it in to a new trailer. We also brought in a response team to 'diaper' the trailer in the interim to help contain it. The transload was successful and the trailer stopped leaking and was cleaned and put on the train back to Chicago.

UNSURE OF HOW BOTTLE BROKE AND NO OTHER INFO WAS GIVEN TO ME. PKG WAS THEN SECURED AND LATER PROCESSED AS DAMAGED. DescribePack: BOTTLE BROKE INSIDE. INNER PACKING SEEMED FINE. item.title: Report X-2023080537
item.description:
Report X-2023080537

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: LEWISTON
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered during the unload sorting process at this station in the morning. the item was brought to the QA dept for further inspection. The outer package had no labels indicating haxardous materials were inside the package. An admin begun the normal inspection while lifting and handling the package and observed their was an inner package with corrosive labels. Immediately the Admin placed the item down and noticed her feet were beginning to feel a "burning sensation." Another admin quickly placed appropriate PPE on and read the label for first aid instructions. A SDS was printed and the admin took measures to wash and the area and seek medical attention along with a manager who completed an incident report. The package was then processed approprately as a hazmat and the containment mitigated and processed. DescribePack: The package was wet and had open closures. Upon inspection the outer package was retaped and the inner package had labels indicating it was corrosive materials inside. The label itself was undeclared. There were 4 gallon plastic jugs of cleanser/degreaser. One jug was missing a cap causing it to leak throughout the package and had noticeably less quantity in the jug. The liquid had saturated the other 3 bottles in the package. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Once Identified as a hazmat the item was placed in a hazmat tote. The process of paperwork was immediately handled. The first aid practice for the substance was printed and the Admin quickly began first aid measures and sought medical attention.

  • Description: On July 28, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink (UN1210) was damaged during transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted surfaces. The EWI crew identified the damaged pail and contained it in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew deployed absorbents and degreaser to the material and utilized hand tools to collect the impacted solids. All additional waste was contained in the same 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

  • Description: On July 26, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1760 was crushed during transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area. Once neutralization was confirmed with pH strips, crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. The undamaged cargo was wiped down and repalletized for continued processing and shipping. All UN1760 impacted materials and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080258
item.description:
Report E-2023080258

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHG experienced a UN1789 J.T. Baker Hydrochloric Acid, SN Volumetric Solution release from (2) 5-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released impacting a 5' x 6" area of the trailer floor due to punctures caused by a load shift. Lye was utilized to neutralize the impacted area and absorbents were deployed and worked in to collect all liquid. The damaged jug and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080256
item.description:
Report E-2023080256

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 25, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of resin solution was punctured and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the resin solution-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and damaged drum were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 85-gallon over-pack for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080255
item.description:
Report E-2023080255

  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 24, 2023, three (3) 55-gallon drums of sodium chlorite were damaged and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew identified the pallet of damaged drums and secured the drums in three (3) 95-gallon overpack drums. HES deployed granular absorbents to the dock floor and worked them in with hand tools. All clean up debris and PPE were contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2023080253
item.description:
Report E-2023080253

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 21, 2023, ten (10) 1-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the pallet on the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. TLE personnel utilized absorbent pads and a degreasing solution to wipe down any impacted freight. Crews cut up the impacted pallet with hand tools and took it for waste. TLE personnel restacked and rewrapped the remediated freight for further shipment. All used absorbent pads, the cut-up pallet, the ten (10) damaged pails, and any miscellaneous waste were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon metal drums.

  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LGT experienced a UN1789 Blue Whale Muriatic Acid release from boxed containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Several other jugs appeared to also have loose caps, saturating their boxes. A total of 5 boxes of bottles were found damaged and impacted or releasing. The impacted dock area was neutralized with sodium bicarb. All jugs were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted cardboard, absorbents and cleanup debris were placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2023080178

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 19, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons pf product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted surfaces. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1263 paint related materials release and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The two (2) damaged 5-gallon pails were placed in another 55-gallon drum, and both drums of waste were staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Description: On July 19, 2023, one (1) 45-pound box of UN3262 powder was punctured and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the trailer interior and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted surfaces. LSH personnel utilized hand tools to remediate the site. The loose product and the damaged container of product were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

  • Description: On July 19, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3295 was damaged and released approximately one half (.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE contained the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum. HCE deployed absorbents and utilized hand tools to collect the impacted absorbents. All impacted absorbents, debris, and PPE were contained in the same 55-gallon drum. HCE labeled and staged the pail onsite to be profiled and disposed of by R+L personnel.

item.title: Report X-2023080478
item.description:
Report X-2023080478

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scan at 0412 on 7/25/2023 at Edin 0785 and placed under the rollers at unload door 6 since it was a misloaded package. At 0700 QA was working on packages in the unload and came across the Item. Outer packaging looked wet damaged, so contents were inspected. Upon inspection it was found that 1 of the inner items had a leak. Package was placed in a yellow salvage drum and secured at QA1 to be processed post sort. DescribePack: Outer package appears wet damaged at the bottom one third / base of the package at one side. Tape closing/securing the bottom of the package is only covering 1/4 of the closure. only 1 of the 4 inner containers appears to be undamaged. 2 items appear dented at their base but have no leak. One inner container is crushed/dented at its base and has leaked over 1/2 of its contents. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA found the package inspection was performed to identify the cause of the wet damage on the outer packaging. When it was found to be caused by the inner contents of the package, item was secured and placed in a yellow salvaged drum and taken to QA1.

item.title: Report E-2023080131
item.description:
Report E-2023080131

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: GRAND VIEW
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 19, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing sodium carbonate was damaged during transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer floor and asphalt roadway as well as the soil/gravel shoulder. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from The L&R Group (TLR) to remediate the impacted surfaces. Crews placed the damaged 50-gallon drum in an 85-gallon over pack drum for disposal. TLR personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and asphalt and worked them in with hand tools. Crews utilized hand tools to collect the absorbents and impacted soil and gravel from the shoulder and placed in a 30-gallon drum for disposal. All sodium carbonate impacted material was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum and one (1) 30-gallon drum and sent with the truck to the Boise, ID RLC terminal.

item.description:
Report E-2023080105

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Trailer had been dropped in drop lot for delivery on Monday 7/31/23 when facility personnel went to retrieve trailer to be unloaded they noticed the spillage under trailer. Containment was set up and trailer was immediately unloaded to get to leaking container. The container was packed in a salvage drum and all contents were cleaned up using the proper PPE and absorbents then deposed of in the proper manner. The gravel under trailer was excavated and disposed of accordingly the new gravel was put back. The spill did not pose a threat to human life or waterways. The failure of the container was determined to be a crack in the bottom of the plastic drum.

Report E-2023080103

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPO experienced a UN1463 Chromium Trioxide release from a 110-pound metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released impacting a 2' x 2' area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The released product, damaged pail, and impacted pallet pieces were collected and containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded from trailer # 819078 from 389-OLIV at door 116 in unload. QA was in area and witnessed package being removed from trailer with visible old damage from leaking contents. QA immediately engaged and used appropriate materials and procedures to mitigate further release. DescribePack: The cap on one of the containers was slightly loose. Additional investigation revealed SPIDR images showing package not oriented correctly while traveling the IC belt at 389-OLIV, which may have contributed to the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was on scene as package was being unloaded and took immediate action to mitigate release.

  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 14, 2023, two (2) 50-gallon drums of cinnamyl nitril (UN3278) were leaking from the bungs and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release. The crew them utilized hand tools to containerize all UN3278-impacted material in one (1) 5-gallon bucket.

item.title: Report X-2023080274
item.description:
Report X-2023080274

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: JONESBORO
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was sent down the line during the sort. Driver noticed the pacakge was broken, and put aside. After the sort when another QA was walking the lines, he noticed that it was sitting to the side, picked it up, and noticed it was broken. It was immediately brought to the Hazmat cage. There was no spillage outside of package. DescribePack: Glass bottle is broken. There is no other packing besides the cardboard suspension that the glass bottle was resting inside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After package was found, it was immediately taken to the Hazmat cage where the fumes could air out. The package had already mostly dried out due to it being alcohol.

  • Description: Four drums of Morpholine (UN2054) were the only cargo left during the unloading process of a trailer. An odor was detected, therefore, a contractor was requested on site for further assessment of the situation. It was discovered that two of the four drums had potentially released approximately one-gallon of product onto the trailer floor throughout transit. The cause is likely corrosion identified at the bottom of the two drums. The drums were overpacked by the contractor.

  • City: NASHUA

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE START OF OUR SORT A HAZARDOUS MATERIALS PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON THE FLOOR OF AN INBOUND TRAILER WITH SOILED CARDBOARD. IT WAS CALLED OUT BY AN HOURLY TO A SUPERVISOR AND NOT TOUCHED. RESPONDER WORE FULL PPE (GOGGLES, BOOTS, GLOVES, AND APRON) AND USED A GREEN LINED SPILL TRAY. NO LEAKAGE WAS DISCOVERED AROUND THE PACKAGE/ON THE FLOOR. WHILE WEARING OUR PPE RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET AND PROCESSED THE MATERIAL THROUGH DMP PROCEDURES.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 14, 2023, one (1) 48-pound box of HA powder (UN3262) was forked and released one (1) pound of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. LSH neutralized the released material and utilized absorbents to collect the spent product. All clean up debris and the damaged box were contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The drum was labeled and staged onsite for profiling and disposal by R+L personnel.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: NEENAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 13, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of a corrosive liquid (UN2922) and one (1) 5-gallon pail of sodium hydroxide (UN1824) were damaged by a forklift and released approximately nine (9) gallons of the two products to the trailer interior and pavement underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Valley Environmental Response (VER) to remediate the impacted site. VER personnel deployed absorbents and a neutralizing agent to remediate the site. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) cubic yard boxes. The impacted pallets were collected and containerized into one (1) cubic yard box. The two (2) damaged pails were collected and containerized into two (2) overpack drums. All containers were staged onsite for disposal by R+L

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 13, 2023, two (2) 5-liter metal cans of UN1263 were crushed during transit and released approximately one quarter (.25) gallon of product to the pallet in the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE personnel downstacked the pallet to find two (2) leaking cans of product. Crews wiped down the impacted freight with universal absorbent pads, and then they staged the remediated freight for further shipment and processing. The leaking cans and miscellaneous cleanup debris were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was staged in the terminal's waste holding room. Crews took the impacted pallet back to their shop for reuse.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 25, 2023, at 1600 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of Zip-Slip 154S Release Agent (UN1993, 3, II) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was reportedly due to a forklift puncture, and it was contained to a 5’x5’ area on the trailer floor. The release was cleaned up with the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release (which was the punctured drum) was containerized in (1) 85-gallon poly metal drum and will be returned to the shipper.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAQ experienced a UN3105 NOROX MEKP-9 release from boxes containing (4) 1-quart poly bottles. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 6' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. A total of (24) 1-quart poly bottles were found damaged and placed into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. Absorbents and sodium bicarb were used to clean the impacted area and then collected along with all impacted cardboard into an additional (3) 55-gallon vented poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 28, 2023, one (1) 250-gallon tote of UN3265 was damaged and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew gravity transferred the contents into one (1) new 250-gallon tote. The old tote was dried, neutralized, and cut up. The cut up tote was contained in one (1) supersack. All Doverphos 213-impacted absorbents, general waste, and PPE were contained in one (1) additional supersack. Both supersacks and the new tote with product were labeled and staged onsite for R+L personnel to profile and dispose of.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A DECLARED LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED AND LABELED UN1987 ALCOHOLS N.O.S. WITH ACCEPTANCE AUDITED SHIPPING PAPERS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED 2 X 1 GALLON CONTAINERS OF PURELL FOODSERVICE SURFACE SANITIZERS. THE BOX WAS FILLED WITH AIR BAGS AND ABSORBENT PADS AROUND AND IN-BETWEEN THE INDIVIDUAL BOTTLES. ONE BOTTLE REMAINED INTACT. ONE BOTTLE WAS CRACKED LEAKING ALMOST THE ENTIRE CONTENTS.

item.title: Report I-2023060066
item.description:
Report I-2023060066

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-25T00:30:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-25
  • City: SUNDANCE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PILOT THOMAS LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver encountered icy road surface which casued him to loose control of his vehicle which resulted in a rollover accident . Pup trailer separated from the lead trailer. Diesel fuel leaked from Compartment One dome cover for approximately 4 hours while waiting for the equipment needed to extract the diesel fuel from the pup trailer. Broadbent and Associates is overseeing the remediation work with Lincoln Environmental doing the actual work. Excavation is expected to begin in June once the snow has melted. Wasatch County Health Department was on scene and approved the remediation plan.
